chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer C Sagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will apply to Rusk County Drug Court and if accepted will participate.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge on each count

timeConds.notes: 58 days credit will apply to conditional jail time

Plea Agreement

Defendant Jennifer C Sagen in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF82.  Agreement has been reached in these matters.  Atty Olson recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Ct 2,4 in 15CF200 and 16CF82 will be DRI, and uncharged bail jumping.   DE will enter a plea of G to amended Ct 1 in 15CF200 and G to Ct 3.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will order sentence withheld, 3 years probation,concurrent, 60 days jail, credit for 58 days, DE will apply for and participate in Rusk County Drug Court if accepted, CC, DNA sample/surcharge.

Defendant Jennifer C Sagen in court.   James Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Aaron Olson appears telephonically for Jennifer C. Sagen - Court in Session - Oral Ruling scheduled for today - Court recites history of this case.  Court orders Officers were correct in how they proceeded with their search warrants and was reasonably granted.  Denies defense motion to suppress evidence.  Attorney Nelson requests one brief clarification.  Court responds.  Attorney Rennicke makes statement to the Court.  Attorney Nelson responds - Trial to be scheduled for 12/19/16 at 9:00 a.m. - Final Pretrial Conference - 11/29/16 at 1:00 p.m. Any motions/motion in limine have filed and served in adequate time for other party to address them.  Any modified JI's to be submitted as well.  Court adjourned 11:15 a.m.

Court will make a ruling on evidence, will make a decision by next Tuesday.  MH will be adjourned until Court makes a decision on the matter.  16CF82-State calls Investigator Riley Kummet, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Objection by Atty Olson, overruled.  State enters exhibit number one, certified bond, received by the court.   Cross by Atty Olson.  State rests, witness dismissed.  State files information.  Court finds probable cause exits, will bind over for JT.  Set for arraignment/MH 8-01-16 @ 1:00PM.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond, requesting modification to $2000.00 cash bond.  Court will order a $2000.00 cash bond, same conditions (16CF82)

Defendant Jennifer C Sagen in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion filed by Atty Olson in court today.  Atty Olson requests plea hearing/motion date.  Court will set for 6-07-16 @ 4:00PM.
Modified bond mailed to DE to sign and return to COCC office.  DE did not sign new bond after court and has no working phone number.

Must remain at her residence in Bruce or her job at Hometown Motors only, with the exception of random drug testing by the SD.  No possession or use of illicit or illegal substances, no possession or use of mind or mood altering substances, no possession of unprescribed medications, no alcohol possession or consumption, no entering premises where alcohol is the primary business.  No contact with Michelle Lake.    If DE finds other employment, she will come back to court for bond modification.  DE may attend church on Sunday mornings in Bruce.  DE may join the 12 step program at her church.  DE may attend medical appointments, DE may leave Rusk County to attend these appointments.
DE did not come to COCC after court to sign a new bond.  KK tried calling DE at the number on file with the court but it is not a working number.
Review hearing on April 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm. ( NOH mailedto Jennifer on 3/16/16 with note to stop at office and sign new bond immediately)

Defendant Jennifer C Sagen in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time set for arraignment.  Deb Nelson also in court from the Dept.  Olson makes comment to ct 2.  Court will enter NG plea as DE remains mute.  Atty asking for bond modification.  Atty Olson asking for any restrictions as to seeing the children be lifted.  Also asking for house arrest be lifted and asking for curfew.  State objects and states that he is awaiting transcript in the chips action.  Court questions State as to the child.  Atty Rennicke speaks of the house arrest, state objects.  Nelson speaks as to the children.  Atty Olson explains as to visitation.  Court will remove the portion as to supervised visitation with the children.  The house arrest portion will remain along with all other conditions.  Set for RH 4-19-16 at 1:00 pm.

Defendant Jennifer C Sagen in court.  Aaron Olson appears by phone for DE.   Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time set for motion hearing for bond review.  Olson would like curfew lifted as she has a number of things she has to take care of.  Also would like to attend 12 step program at church.  DE also has children and needs to go to their functions.  State objects as this is the first time he has heard of this motion.  State does not object to Dr. appointment.  State is asking for some sort of an evening curfew.  State is objecting to DE driving around cars for work.  Court will modify bond for the purposes of seeking medical attn.  De may leave Rusk county for medical attention and may join the 12 step program.  Court will not allow DE to go to school functions.  Court will not allow her to drive cars around.

Must remain at her residence in Bruce or her job at Hometown Motors only, with the exception of random drug testing by the SD.  No possession or use of illicit or illegal substances, no possession or use of mind or mood altering substances, no possession of unprescribed medications, no alcohol possession or consumption, no entering premises where alcohol is the primary business.  No contact with Michelle Lake.  Any visitation with her children will be at her home and supervised.  If DE finds other employment, she will come back to court for bond modification.  DE may attend church on Sunday mornings in Bruce.  DE may join the 12 step program at her church.  DE may attend medical appointments, DE may leave Rusk County to attend these appointments.
